newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: South Korea sees investment prospects in Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: South Korea sees investment prospects in Pakistan.

text.p: A South Korean deputy minister said on Tuesday Pakistan's economic liberalisation provided excellent additional investment prospects for his country.

Future cooperation and long-term prospects for Korean investment in Pakistan would be in the areas of heavy and chemical industry and infrastructure development, said Korean Deputy Minister for Trade, Industry and Investment Choo Jun Suk at a meeting of Pakistan-Korea Economic Cooperation Committee.
Suk said 15 Korean companies had invested $170 million in the manufacturing and services sectors, but the amount was very small compared to the potential of the two countries.
"The overall industrial structures of Pakistan and Korea are highly complementary... by playing to these strengths, we can build a strong, dynamic partnership."

Pakistan possessed a large pool of manpower and consumer market, while Korea had strong manufacturing base, marketing expertise and advanced technology, he said adding that the businessmen of both countries could utilise each others' experiences.
